Class Formula

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Formula

        public Formula​(ArrayList<Term> terms)
        Makes a formula containing a copy of terms.

      • Formula

        public Formula​(String s)
        Parses s to construct a formula. s will be a legal sequence of terms with no whitespace, e.g. "AX3YM67" or "Z". The terms in the field must be in the same order as in s.

    • Method Detail

      • getTerms

        public ArrayList<Term> getTerms()
        Returns the terms of the formula.

      • lastUC

        public static int lastUC​(String s)
        Returns the index in s where the rightmost upper-case letter sits, e.g. lastTerm("AX3YM67") returns 4. Returns -1 if there are no upper-case letters.

      • countElement

        public int countElement​(char element)
        Returns the total number of atoms of element in terms. e.g. if terms = <,,>, countElement('W') returns 7, countElement('X') returns 1, and countElement('Q') returns 0.

      • standardise

        public void standardise()
        Puts terms in standardised form, where each element present is represented by exactly one term, and terms are in alphabetical order. e.g. <,,,,> becomes <,,>.

      • isIsomer

        public boolean isIsomer​(Formula other)
        Returns true iff this formula and other are isomers, i.e. they contain the same number of every Bydysawd element.

      • display

        public String display()
        Returns the formula as a String. e.g. if terms = <,,>, it returns "B22ED3".
